comment.body: So, I did all this, except the KxoID part because it keeps freezing like [this](https://files.catbox.moe/cxfkga.png) as it did before, and I just tried removing the 0background.py and 0config.json to see if that fixed it and it doesn't change anything, so I can't really do much about that? And I'm not seeing any `[KxoNetwork]` logs in the browser's JS console. Is that not the console you were talking about? [this is what I'm getting since I sent that command](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?16PfVSZrUZuwTgs7wBt1t3ZK9rsvdskoe5_0). Not sure why it doesn't work at all like this. :c

Hmmm... I restarted Zeronet to see if maybe I could get it to work, but it still stays stuck at the registering part, however when zeronet starts, I get this line in Zeronet's console, and absolutely nothing about KxoNetwork. Is that maybe related? `[13:34:13] PluginManager Plugin BackgroundProcessing load error: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'BackgroundPlugin' in PluginManager.py line 138 > BackgroundProcessing/__init__.py line 1` This error is why I thought maybe there was an issue with the BackgroundPlugin.py file being completely empty.

@Git Center: Pretty sure that I am:
```
[kusoneko@aurora BackgroundProcessing]$ git pull
remote: Enumerating objects: 11, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (11/11), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (5/5), done.
remote: Total 8 (delta 4), reused 7 (delta 3), pack-reused 0
Unpacking objects: 100% (8/8), done.
From https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/Plugin-BackgroundProcessing
   5e26866..80efb3c  py3        -> origin/py3
Already up to date.
```
Just to be sure I did the same on the PeerMessage plugin as well:
```
[kusoneko@aurora PeerMessage]$ git branch
  master
* py3
[kusoneko@aurora PeerMessage]$ git pull
Already up to date.
```
So that doesn't appear to be the problem.

@Git Center: Nevermind, you were right, I was pretty sure I was on the py3 branch but apparently I wasn't:
```
[kusoneko@aurora PeerMessage]$ cd ../BackgroundProcessing
[kusoneko@aurora BackgroundProcessing]$ git branch
* master
  py3
[kusoneko@aurora BackgroundProcessing]$ git checkout py3
Switched to branch 'py3'
[kusoneko@aurora BackgroundProcessing]$ git branch
  master
* py3
[kusoneko@aurora BackgroundProcessing]$ git pull
Updating 8d7ffb1..80efb3c
Fast-forward
 SitePlugin.py           | 27 +++++++++++++++++++++------
 __init__.py             | 20 ++++++++++++++------
 crypt.py                | 30 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 sandboxer/__init__.py   | 88 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++-----------------------------------------
 sandboxer/runtime.py    | 35 +++++++++++++----------------------
 sandboxer/scope.py      | 98 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++---------
 sandboxer/vmbuiltins.py | 21 +++++++++++++++++----
 spawner.py              | 21 +++++++--------------
 util.py                 | 10 ++++++++++
 zeroframe.py            | 11 +++++++++--
 10 files changed, 257 insertions(+), 104 deletions(-)
 create mode 100644 crypt.py
 create mode 100644 util.py
```
gonna restart zeronet and retry -- on that topic, someone should suggest the addition of a "Restart ZeroNet" option under the "Shutdown ZeroNet" in the ZeroHello dropdown menu.
So, now it all works but this happened: `[KxoNetwork] Unknown command: register` when trying to register.

Yeah I have an issue with my IDs tbh, I kinda originally called it Kusoneko.bit and then realized since I don't own kusoneko.bit maybe I should remove the .bit, and while at it uncapitalize it so it stops bugging me. Except, even though I changed that in both the id zite and my users.json, it still shows the id I created with that as kusoneko@Kusoneko.bit... I still have no clue why it's doing that, I kinda figured changing it shouldn't involve removing the whole thing, but it doesn't appear to work like that?

Also, as for the blog, I'm pretty sure it's signed, but I read somewhere that using cert_signers besides KxoID and ZeroID sometimes causes it to stop comments for some reason... I'm not sure how I'm supposed to fix that though?

> Also, as for the blog, I'm pretty sure it's signed, but I read somewhere that using cert_signers besides KxoID and ZeroID sometimes causes it to stop comments for some reason... I'm not sure how I'm supposed to fix that though?

On that, I'm likely to look into making a new blog system myself later on. Not in the next few weeks, more likely in the next several months, since I also have other plans as well.

> Also, I couldn't post to your blog because you probably haven't signed data/users/content.json correctly.

So, I just tried removing everything but ZeroID from the cert_signers and signing the data/users/content.json, and signing it works and publishes it to peers, but then I tested commenting and that's not working at all. it doesn't publish it and idk why. This is so weird. Maybe the problem isn't the cert_signers after all.
And if I leave all the cert_signers in, for some reason you can't select any identity besides ZeroID... now I'm really confused. I don't get it at all.

@Git Center: Okay, so now they're added to all.js as well (and I find that odd that you need to add them to both the json and the all.js file, in my mind it should just take the id providers from the data/users/content.json, and apparently now commenting works, as in it successfully publishes? So I guess the problem was the discrepancy in the id providers or something?

I've still got that annoying bug with my kusonekoid though where it refuses to change the name of the id provider in id selection page, I'm not sure how to fix that since even changing all instances of the old name in users.json doesn't change it at all.
I'm not currently a developer but I'm active and from Canada
@Git Center: I'm curious about what you're planning to do with that info too tbh.
lol what? how? it doesn't violate any copyright on it's own?
